content: Kees van Berkel - TU WienSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationKees van Berkel - Researcher in AI and PhilosophyAssistant Professor AI Ethics, TU WienAcademic BioPublicationsAcademic ServicesTeachingAbout me:I am an Assistant Professor of AI ethics at the Institute of Logic and Computation, TU Wien. My core research interests are in AI Ethics and logical and formal argumentative perspectives on normative reasoning. It includes the study of norm explanations in AI, the logical analysis of meta-ethical principles, proof theory for defeasible normative reasoning, and argumentative characterizations of nonmonotonic deontic logics.News:Christian Strasser and I gave a foundational course at ESSLLI 2025, at Ruhr University Bochum, July 2025. Course: introduction to logical argumentation (see the course page for content). See this page for old (archived) news.  Academic biography:> 2024. Co-coordinator of the special interest group "AI Ethics" and the Center for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (CAIML). > 2024. Key researcher in the Cluster of Excellence Bilateral AI (BILAI), within the research module "Ethical AI Systems". The affiliation hosts a PhD position on AI Alignment and Dialogues.> 2024. Assistant Professor in AI Ethics at the Institute for Logic and Computation, TU Wien, Austria (tenure track). > 2024.
